title: Redemption Games
outcome: In a desperate effort to co-opt the ritual-driven crisis, the Council pivots the BCI’s 'refuse mode' into a game, issuing neighborhood-based redemption challenges for restoring services. Some communities thrive on solidarity, others fracture under moral stress. Local bonds grow stronger than faith in central power.

events.description: The Council launches citywide 'Redemption Games.' Districts are issued moral challenges—aid the vulnerable, mediate conflicts, or make tough choices impacting access to services.
Neighborhood groups mobilize, some forging deep solidarity through cooperation, others splintering as disputes arise over challenge tactics and sacrifice.
Temporary restoration of BCI services in high-performing areas sparks open rivalry between neighborhoods. Accusations of sabotage and scapegoating surface.
Council-controlled news praises the success of the 'games' but local leaders openly debate declining trust in the central system versus newfound neighborhood autonomy.
